wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Saunders Rich (28 June 1807 – 4 September 1865) was an English cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1833 to 1838.  A left-handed batsman, he made six known appearances in first-class matches.  He represented the South in the North v. South series.

response: * 1 – Arthur Rich, Daniel Hayward, Edward Grimston, Frederick Ponsonby, Henry Hall, John Bayley, John Gibson, Joe Guy, John Wenman, Thomas Heath, William Clarke, William Dorrinton, William Ward, Will Caldecourt
